head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 24/1/73 ¶ ¶ I send you, dear Dr Hector, ¶ fresh ¶ seeds of three species of Kentia from Lord Howe's Island, which will thrive in your forest groves or other sheltered localit...

div.p: Folder 2, box 58, James Hector, correspondence received, Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa Archives, Wellington.

I send you, dear Dr Hector, fresh seeds of three species of Kentia from Lord Howe's Island, which will thrive in your forest groves or other sheltered localities along with your own Kentia sapida. They are stately plants and not easily obtained. The description I gave in the 7th vol. of fragm. phytogr. austr.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I shall require various seeds from your by & bye.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
F.M.
MS annotation presumably by Hector: 'Ansd. 4.2.73'. See J. Hector to M, 4 February 1873.
